faq.heading: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.desc: Everything you need to know about Omega products

items.question: What is a hardware wallet?
items.answer: A hardware wallet is a physical device that stores your cryptocurrency private keys offline, providing the highest level of security for your digital assets.

items.question: How do you ensure the accuracy and safety of your AI models?
items.answer: We ensure accuracy and safety by training on diverse data, applying strict safeguards, and continuously improving through testing and feedback.

items.question: Which cryptocurrencies are supported?
items.answer: We support major cryptocurrencies including Bitcoin, Ethereum, and other widely used digital assets.

items.question: Is my crypto safe if I lose my hardware wallet?
items.answer: Yes, your crypto is safe as long as you have your recovery phrase, since you can restore access on a new wallet.

items.question: How long does shipping take?
items.answer: Shipping typically takes 3 to 7 business days, depending on your location.

section1.heading: Omega Hardware Wallet
section1.description: The ultimate cryptocurrency security device. Confirm transactions on a secure element and keep your private keys completely offline. Military-grade protection for your digital assets.
list: Secure Element chip with CC EAL5+ certification

details.title: Product Details
details.description: The Omega Hardware Wallet Standard provides cold storage security for your digital assets.

backup.title: SLIP39 & the 3-2-1 backup method
backup.desc: Omega Seed supports both standard BIP39 seeds and SLIP39 (Shamir) shares. Combine this with the 3-2-1 rule for robust disaster recovery.
backup.card1desc: SLIP39 (Shamir's Secret-Sharing for mnemonics) splits your secret into multiple shares. A threshold of shares must be combined to reconstruct the wallet — e.g., 3 out of 5.
list1: Distribute shares across locations or trusted parties.
Loses of some shares do not compromise funds.
Store each share on a separate Omega Seed plate.
list2: With at least one backup stored off-site
On at least two different media or locations.
Keep three backups (e.g., one BIP39 plate + two SLIP39 shares).

section2.title: Explore Omega Seedphrase
section2.desc: Complete your setup with our handcrafted leather case featuring RFID blocking technology.
section2.heading: Omega Seedphrase
section2.description: Titanium recovery solution designed for long - term protection of your Secret Recovery Phrase.

details.question: What is a seed phrase?
details.answer: A seed phrase is a human-readable list of 12-24 words that encodes the master secret of your wallet. With these words, you can recreate all private keys and restore access to your funds. Anyone who has the phrase can move your assets — keep it offline and never share it.

details.question: How it works with Omega
details.answer: Your Omega Hardware Wallet generates the seed offline. You confirm and store it securely. If you ever need to restore, enter the words into any BIP39‑compatible wallet (12/24 words) to regain access.
list: Fire, water and corrosion resistance far beyond paper or plastic.
Titanium durability — no ink to fade, no lamination to fail.
Fully offline self-custody; no cloud or online exposure.

support.title: How can we help you?
support.desc1: Get the support you need for your Omega products. Our expert team is here to help you secure your cryptocurrency with confidence.
support.desc2: Can't find what you're looking for? Send us a message and we'll get back to you.

form.desc3: Send us a message and we'll respond within 2 hours during business hours

privacyPolicy.heading: Privacy Policy
privacyPolicy.description: How we collect, use and protect your information.

sections.title: Introduction
sections.desc:
Omega Wallet ('we,' 'our,' or 'us') is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you use our software wallet, hardware wallet, website, or any related services (collectively, the 'Services'). 

 Please read this Privacy Policy carefully. By accessing or using our Services, you acknowledge that you have read, understood, and agree to be bound by all the terms of this Privacy Policy.

Personal Information.desc: We may collect personal information that you voluntarily provide to us when you:
points: Register for an account
Sign up for our newsletter
Contact our support team
Participate in promotions or surveys
Make a purchase
Personal Information.note: This information may include your name, email address, phone number, mailing address, and payment information

Non-Personal Information.desc: We may also collect non-personal information about how you interact with our Services, including:
points: Device information (type, operating system, browser)
IP address
Usage data (pages visited, time spent)
Referral sources

How We Use Your Information.desc: We may use the information we collect for various purposes, including to:
points: Provide, maintain, and improve our Services
Process transactions and send related information
Send administrative information, such as updates or security alerts
Respond to your comments, questions, and requests
Send promotional communications, such as special offers or newsletters
Monitor and analyze trends, usage, and activities
Detect, prevent, and address technical issues
Protect against fraudulent, unauthorized, or illegal activity

Wallet Privacy and Cryptocurrency Transa:
Omega Wallet is designed with your privacy in mind. We do not have access to your private keys, recovery phrases, or the ability to initiate transactions on your behalf. Your private keys are stored locally on your device (for software wallets) or on the secure element of your hardware wallet. 

 While blockchain transactions are publicly visible, we do not collect or store information that links your identity to your blockchain addresses unless you explicitly provide this information to us.
Cookies and Tracking Technologies:
We use cookies and similar tracking technologies to track activity on our website and hold certain information. Cookies are files with a small amount of data that may include an anonymous unique identifier.

 You can instruct your browser to refuse all cookies or to indicate when a cookie is being sent. However, if you do not accept cookies, you may not be able to use some portions of our Services.

Disclosure of Your Information.desc: We may disclose your information in the following situations:
points: Service Providers: We may share your information with third-party vendors, service providers, and other business partners who perform services on our behalf.
Business Transfers: If we are involved in a merger, acquisition, or sale of all or a portion of our assets, your information may be transferred as part of that transaction.
Legal Requirements: We may disclose your information if required to do so by law or in response to valid requests by public authorities.
Protection of Rights: We may disclose your information to protect and defend our rights, property, or safety, or those of our users or third parties.

Data Security: We implement appropriate technical and organizational measures to protect the security of your personal information. However, please be aware that no method of transmission over the Internet or method of electronic storage is 100% secure.

Your Rights.desc: Depending on your location, you may have certain rights regarding your personal information, including:
points: The right to access the personal information we have about you
The right to request correction of inaccurate information
The right to request deletion of your personal information
The right to object to or restrict processing of your personal information
The right to data portability
The right to withdraw consent
Your Rights.note: To exercise these rights, please contact us using the information provided in the 'Contact Us' section below.

Children's Privacy: Our Services are not intended for individuals under the age of 18. We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under 18. If you are a parent or guardian and believe that your child has provided us with personal information, please contact us.
Changes to This Privacy Policy: We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page and updating the 'Last Updated' date. You are advised to review this Privacy Policy periodically for any changes.

sections.title: Contact Us
sections.desc: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at:
sections.address: Address: 123 Blockchain Street, San Francisco, CA 94103, United States

termsAndCondition.heading: Terms of Services
termsAndCondition.description: The rules and guidelines for using Omega Wallet

sections.title: 1. Introduction and Acceptance
sections.desc:
Welcome to Omega Wallet. These Terms of Service ('Terms') govern your access to and use of the Omega Wallet software application, hardware devices, website, and related services (collectively, the 'Services') provided by Omega Wallet ('we,' 'our,' or 'us'). 

By accessing or using our Services, you agree to be bound by these Terms. If you do not agree to these Terms, you may not access or use the Services..

sections.title: 2. Eligibility
sections.desc:
You must be at least 18 years old to use our Services. By using our Services, you represent and warrant that you meet this requirement and that you have the right, authority, and capacity to enter into these Terms.

 If you are using the Services on behalf of an entity, organization, or company, you represent and warrant that you have the authority to bind that organization to these Terms and you agree to be bound by these Terms on behalf of that organization.

sections.title: 3. Account Registration and Security
sections.desc:
Some features of our Services may require you to register for an account. When you register, you agree to provide accurate, current, and complete information and to update this information to maintain its accuracy. 

 You are responsible for maintaining the confidentiality of your account credentials, including your password and recovery phrase. You agree not to share your account credentials with any third party. You are solely responsible for all activities that occur under your account. 

 You must immediately notify us of any unauthorized use of your account or any other breach of security. We cannot and will not be liable for any loss or damage arising from your failure to comply with these requirements.

sections.title: 4. Wallet Services
sections.desc: Omega Wallet provides software and hardware wallet solutions for storing, sending, and receiving cryptocurrencies. Our Services allow you to:
points: Create and manage cryptocurrency wallets
Store private keys securely
Send and receive cryptocurrency transactions
View transaction history and balances
Exchange cryptocurrencies (where available)
sections.note: You acknowledge that cryptocurrency transactions are irreversible and that we have no control over the blockchain networks on which transactions are processed. We cannot cancel, reverse, or refund transactions once they have been broadcast to the network.

sections.title: 5. User Responsibilities
sections.desc: When using our Services, you agree to:
points: Comply with all applicable laws and regulations
Secure your recovery phrase and private keys
Verify all transaction details before confirming
Maintain up-to-date software and firmware
Use the Services only for lawful purposes
points2: Use the Services for any illegal activities
Attempt to reverse-engineer or modify our software or hardware
Interfere with or disrupt the Services or servers
Use the Services to harm others or their property

sections.title: 6. Fees and Payments
sections.desc:
We charge fees for certain aspects of our Services, such as hardware wallet purchases and certain premium features. All fees are clearly disclosed before you complete a purchase or transaction.

 Blockchain network fees (such as gas fees on Ethereum) are determined by the respective blockchain networks and are not set by or paid to Omega Wallet. You are responsible for all network fees associated with your transactions.

sections.title: 7. Intellectual Property
sections.desc:
All content, features, and functionality of our Services, including but not limited to text, graphics, logos, icons, images, audio clips, digital downloads, data compilations, software, and the design, selection, and arrangement thereof, are owned by Omega Wallet, our licensors, or other providers of such material and are protected by copyright, trademark, patent, trade secret, and other intellectual property or proprietary rights laws. 

 These Terms do not grant you any right, title, or interest in the Services or our content, nor any intellectual property rights except for the limited license to use the Services in accordance with these Terms.

sections.title: 8. Disclaimers and Limitations of Liability
sections.highlight1: THE SERVICES ARE PROVIDED 'AS IS' AND 'AS AVAILABLE' WITHOUT WARRANTIES OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED.
sections.desc: We do not guarantee that the Services will be uninterrupted, secure, or error-free.
sections.highlight2: TO THE FULLEST EXTENT PERMITTED BY LAW, OMEGA WALLET SHALL NOT BE LIABLE FOR ANY INDIRECT, INCIDENTAL, SPECIAL, CONSEQUENTIAL, OR PUNITIVE DAMAGES, INCLUDING LOSS OF PROFITS, DATA, OR USE, ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THESE TERMS OR THE SERVICES.
sections.desc2: We are not responsible for any loss of funds due to:
points2: User error (such as sending to the wrong addresses)
Loss of recovery phrases or private keys
Unauthorized access to your device or account
Regulatory actions or changes in law

sections.title: 9. Indemnification
sections.desc: You agree to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Omega Wallet and its officers, directors, employees, agents, and affiliates from and against any and all claims, liabilities, damages, losses, costs, expenses, or fees (including reasonable attorneys' fees) that arise from or relate to: (a) your use of the Services; (b) your violation of these Terms; (c) your violation of any rights of any other person or entity; or (d) your violation of any laws or regulations.

sections.title: 10. Governing Law
sections.desc: These Terms shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of California, without regard to its conflict of law provisions. Any legal action or proceeding arising out of or relating to these Terms or the Services shall be brought exclusively in the federal or state courts located in San Francisco, California, and you consent to the personal jurisdiction of such courts.

sections.title: 11. Modifications to Terms
sections.desc: We reserve the right to modify these Terms at any time. If we make changes, we will provide notice by posting the updated Terms on our website and updating the 'Last Updated' date. Your continued use of the Services after such changes constitutes your acceptance of the new Terms.

sections.title: 12. Termination
sections.desc: We may terminate or suspend your access to the Services immediately, without prior notice or liability, for any reason, including if you breach these Terms. Upon termination, your right to use the Services will immediately cease.

sections.title: 13. Contact Us
sections.desc: If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at:
sections.address: Address: 123 Blockchain Street, San Francisco, CA 94103, United States
